text: After your database has finished being created,
the Oracle Secure Backup Cloud Module installer will run.
Before we get started, you will need to have your AWS Access Key,
your AWS Secret Access Key,
and your Oracle Technology Network Username and Password.
If you do not yet have an OTN account,
you can sign up for one at http://oracle.com/technetwork.
To locate your Access Key and Secret Access Key, go to the AWS Management Console.
Click on your name in the upper right-hand corner, and select Security Credentials.
Click on Access Credentials.
Here you will see your Access Keys.
To retrieve your Secret Access Key, click on Show.
You can highlight these strings to copy and paste them when you are prompted for them later.
Press Enter to begin configuring the OSB Cloud Module.
When prompted for your ORACLE_HOME, hit Enter to accept the default.
For ORACLE_SID, enter the name of your database.
In this example, we used testdb.
Enter your AWS Access Key ID.
This will not echo to the screen.
Enter your AWS Secret Access Key.
Enter your Oracle Technology Network Username and Password.
When prompted for the location of your Oracle Wallet,
press Enter to accept the default.
The OSB installer will verify your AWS credentials and create
an Amazon S3 bucket for storing your database backups.
After verifying the license, the wallet and configuration files
will be created and the module library will be downloaded
from Oracle's servers and installed.
When prompted to schedule a backup, type no.
If you received an error during this process,
the OSB Cloud Module installer needs to be updated.
Proceed to the next video to download the latest version
of the OSB Cloud Module from the Oracle Technology Network website.
Otherwise, you can skip that step
and continue to the step for backing up your database.
